string.name: string
notes: In RDF serializations, a slot with range of string is treated as a literal or type xsd:string.   If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "string".

integer.name: integer
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "integer".

boolean.name: boolean
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "boolean".

float.name: float
float.description: A real number that conforms to the xsd:float specification
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "float".

double.name: double
double.description: A real number that conforms to the xsd:double specification
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "double".

decimal.name: decimal
decimal.description: A real number with arbitrary precision that conforms to the xsd:decimal specification
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "decimal".

time.name: time
time.description: A time object represents a (local) time of day, independent of any particular day
notes: URI is dateTime because OWL reasoners do not work with straight date or time
If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "time".

date.name: date
date.description: a date (year, month and day) in an idealized calendar
notes: URI is dateTime because OWL reasoners don't work with straight date or time
If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "date".

datetime.name: datetime
datetime.description: The combination of a date and time
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "datetime".

date_or_datetime.name: date_or_datetime
date_or_datetime.description: Either a date or a datetime
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "date_or_datetime".

uriorcurie.name: uriorcurie
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "uriorcurie".

curie.name: curie
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "curie".
comments: in RDF serializations this MUST be expanded to a URI
in non-RDF serializations MAY be serialized as the compact representation

uri.name: uri
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "uri".
comments: in RDF serializations a slot with range of uri is treated as a literal or type xsd:anyURI unless it is an identifier or a reference to an identifier, in which case it is translated directly to a node

ncname.name: ncname
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "ncname".

objectidentifier.name: objectidentifier
objectidentifier.description: A URI or CURIE that represents an object in the model.
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "objectidentifier".
comments: Used for inheritance and type checking

nodeidentifier.name: nodeidentifier
nodeidentifier.description: A URI, CURIE or BNODE that represents a node in a model.
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "nodeidentifier".

jsonpointer.name: jsonpointer
jsonpointer.description: A string encoding a JSON Pointer. The value of the string MUST conform to JSON Point syntax and SHOULD dereference to a valid object within the current instance document when encoded in tree form.
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "jsonpointer".

jsonpath.name: jsonpath
jsonpath.description: A string encoding a JSON Path. The value of the string MUST conform to JSON Point syntax and SHOULD dereference to zero or more valid objects within the current instance document when encoded in tree form.
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "jsonpath".

sparqlpath.name: sparqlpath
sparqlpath.description: A string encoding a SPARQL Property Path. The value of the string MUST conform to SPARQL syntax and SHOULD dereference to zero or more valid objects within the current instance document when encoded as RDF.
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "sparqlpath".

PretreatmentMethods.name: PretreatmentMethods
PretreatmentMethods.description: Specify the types of general pretreatment methods applied for decontamination.

Col.description: Collagen (normally including deminieralisation wtih or without a base step, followed by gelatinisation and filtration, often called the 'Longin method')

UF_Col.description: Ultrafiltered collagen (normally including demineralisation with or without a base step, followed by gelatinisation, filtration and ultrafiltration)

XAD.description: Amino acids purified by XAD-2 resin

IE.description: Amino acids purified by other ion exchange resin

ABOx.description: Acid-base-oxidation (ABOx, without the stepped combustion step)

Alph_Cel.description: Alphacellulose (normally containing bleach followed by ABA)

HUMIC.description: Base soluble fraction (normally preceeded by acid)

RadiocarbonMeasurementMethod.name: RadiocarbonMeasurementMethod
RadiocarbonMeasurementMethod.description: Method used to obtain the radiocarbon determination.

Conventional.description: Beta counting methods such as gas proportional counting (GPC) or liquid scintillation counting (LSC)

Delta13CMeasurementMethod.name: Delta13CMeasurementMethod
Delta13CMeasurementMethod.description: Which spectrophotometry method was used to measure the delta carbon-13 value, either with Isotope Ratio Mass Spectrometer (IRMS) or Accelerated Mass Spectrometer (AMS).

lab_code.name: lab_code
lab_code.description:
Unique laboratory code designation of the institution that made the measurement.
This is the prefix used for each determination ID. The prefix should be
derived from: https://radiocarbon.webhost.uits.arizona.edu/laboratories.
lab_code.title: Laboratory code designation

lab_id.name: lab_id
lab_id.description:
The unique identifier associated with a specific radiocarbon determination,
without the radiocarbon laboratory identifier.
lab_id.title: Radiocarbon determination identifier

conventional_age.name: conventional_age
conventional_age.description:
The uncalibrated age from the laboratory measurement. Also known as the
conventional radiocarbon age (CRA). Should be a conventional 14C age (i.e., 14C year BP)
NOT in AD/BC format. This is typically the 'raw' age reported by the radiocarbon lab, in
Before Present (BP) notation.
conventional_age.title: Conventional radiocarbon age

conventional_age_error.name: conventional_age_error
conventional_age_error.description:
The 1-standard deviation around the conventional radiocarbon age (C14) measurement,
normally indicated as a ± after the main age. Must be in the same format (i.e. 14C yr BP).
Sometimes referred to as the "error" or "sigma" of the measurement.
conventional_age_error.title: Conventional radiocarbon age error

f14c.name: f14c
f14c.description:
The F14C value from the laboratory measurement, i.e. the fraction modern carbon.
For older determinations, generally equivalent to "percent modern" (pMC, or pM) divided by 100.
f14c.title: F14C radiocarbon value

f14c_error.name: f14c_error
f14c_error.description:
The 1-standard deviation uncertainty around the F14C (C14) measurement,
normally indicated as a ± after the main value. Must be in the same format.
Sometimes referred to as the "error" or "sigma" of the measurement.
f14c_error.title: F14C radiocarbon error

delta_13_c_calculation_method.name: delta_13_c_calculation_method
delta_13_c_calculation_method.description:
Whether the radiocarbon date was calculated with an AMS derived δ13C, an IRMS derived δ13C,
an alternative δ13C measurement method or an assumed δ13C.
delta_13_c_calculation_method.title: Delta 13C age calculation method

sample_ids.name: sample_ids
sample_ids.description:
Any identifier associated with the sample under measurement
(e.g. sample collection ID, archive object accession, ICOM/CIDOC Museum ID).
sample_ids.title: Sample identifiers

sample_material.name: sample_material
sample_material.description:
Material of the sample used to extract carbon used for radiocarbon dating measurements.
Use ontology terms where possible, e.g. from UBERON for anatomical parts, or ENVO for other
organic samples.
sample_material.title: Radiocarbon dating sample material

sample_taxon_id.name: sample_taxon_id
sample_taxon_id.description:
A taxonomic ID of the organism from which the sample used to extract carbon used for
radiocarbon measurement originated. The taxonomic ID should come from an established
ontology or database.
sample_taxon_id.title: Radiocarbon dating sample taxon

sample_taxon_id_confidence.name: sample_taxon_id_confidence
sample_taxon_id_confidence.description:
Specify the level of confidence of an exact taxon identification.
If secure identification, indicate 'true', if identification is unclear or
uncertain specify 'false'.
sample_taxon_id_confidence.title: Confident in taxon assignment

sample_taxon_scientific_name.name: sample_taxon_scientific_name
sample_taxon_scientific_name.description:
A scientific name of the taxon corresponding to the taxonomic ID, or when a
taxonomic ID does not currently exist for the specific taxon.
sample_taxon_scientific_name.title: Scientific name of the sample taxon

sample_anatomical_part.name: sample_anatomical_part
sample_anatomical_part.description: Anatomical part from which the sample is derived.
sample_anatomical_part.title: Anatomical part from which the sample is derived

suspected_sample_contamination.name: suspected_sample_contamination
suspected_sample_contamination.description:
Specify whether the sample has suspected contamination that may influence measurement
(organic glue, consolidant, rootlets, embalming solution, staining etc.).
suspected_sample_contamination.title: Suspected sample contamination

suspected_sample_contamination_descripti.name: suspected_sample_contamination_description
suspected_sample_contamination_descripti.description:
If a sample has a suspected contamination (suspected_sample_contamination), provide a short
description of the contamination.
suspected_sample_contamination_descripti.title: Suspected sample contamination description

examples.value: Consolidant was applied to the skull to stabilise the bone.
Sample was preserved in a embalming solution containing formaldehyde and alcohol.

sample_location.name: sample_location
sample_location.description: Name of the geographic location from which the sample originated.
sample_location.title: Sample location

decimal_latitude.name: decimal_latitude
decimal_latitude.description:
The geographic latitude (in decimal degrees, using the spatial reference system) of the geographic center of a dcterms:Location. Positive values are north
of the Equator, negative values are south of it. Legal values lie between -90 and 90, inclusive.
decimal_latitude.title: Decimal latitude

decimal_longitude.name: decimal_longitude
decimal_longitude.description:
The geographic longitude (in decimal degrees, using the spatial reference system) of the
geographic center of a dcterms:Location. Positive values are east of the Greenwich Meridian,
negative values are west of it. Legal values lie between -180 and 180, inclusive.
decimal_longitude.title: Decimal longitude

coordinate_precision.name: coordinate_precision
coordinate_precision.description:
A decimal representation of the precision of the coordinates given in the decimal_latitude
and decimal_longitude.
coordinate_precision.title: Coordinate precision

pretreatment_methods.name: pretreatment_methods
pretreatment_methods.description: Specify the types of general pretreatment methods applied for decontamination.
pretreatment_methods.title: Radiocarbon pretreatment methods

pretreatment_method_description.name: pretreatment_method_description
pretreatment_method_description.description: Description of specific pretreatment method used for decontamination of sample prior determination.
pretreatment_method_description.title: Radiocarbon pretreatment method description

examples.value: Samples were pretreated following Brock et al. (2010). Briefly, bone was demineralised (0.5M HCl, overnight), washed in base (0.1M NaOH, 30 min, RT) and acid (0.5M HCl, 1 hour, RT) before gelatinisation (0.001M HCl, 20 hours, 70oC), filtration (Ezee(TM)) and ultrafiltration (Vivaspin(TM) 30 kDa MWCO)
A dremel drill was used to remove visibly altered shell leaving dense translucent carbonate;  Charcoal was treated with HCl, NaOH and HCl.

pretreatment_method_protocol.name: pretreatment_method_protocol
pretreatment_method_protocol.description: A DOI, URL, or PMID to a publication describing the specific method of pretreatment applied.
pretreatment_method_protocol.title: Radiocarbon pretreatment method protocol

measurement_method.name: measurement_method
measurement_method.description: Type of measurement method the determination was made by.
measurement_method.title: Radiocarbon measurement method

sample_starting_weight.name: sample_starting_weight
sample_starting_weight.description: Amount of sample material used at beginning of measurement in miligrams (mg).
sample_starting_weight.title: Sample starting weight

pretreatment_yield.name: pretreatment_yield
pretreatment_yield.description: Amount of sample remaining after pretreatment in miligrams (mg).
pretreatment_yield.title: Weight after pretreatment

pretreatment_proportion_yield.name: pretreatment_proportion_yield
pretreatment_proportion_yield.description: Proportion of weight after pretreatment to sample starting weight represented as a value between 0 and 1.
pretreatment_proportion_yield.title: Proportion yield after pretreatment

carbon_proportion.name: carbon_proportion
carbon_proportion.description:
Proportion of carbon in a non-proteinaceous sample used for dating (such as charcoal),
expressed as a value between 0 and 1. Used as a quality control measurement.
carbon_proportion.title: Carbon proportion

delta_13_c.name: delta_13_c
delta_13_c.description:
The delta carbon-13 value of the sample (δ13C), which is the ratio of the stable isotope
13C to 12C, expressed in per mil (‰) notation. Used as a quality control measurement.
delta_13_c.title: Delta 13C value

delta_13_c_error.name: delta_13_c_error
delta_13_c_error.description:
The error associated with the delta carbon-13 (δ13C) value expressed (‰) notation.
Used as a quality control measurement.
delta_13_c_error.title: Delta 13C error

delta_13_c_method.name: delta_13_c_method
delta_13_c_method.description:
Which spectrophotometry method was used to measure the delta carbon-13 value,
either with Isotope Ratio Mass Spectrometer (IRMS) or Accelerated Mass Spectrometer (AMS).
delta_13_c_method.title: Delta 13C measurement method

suspected_reservoir_effect.name: suspected_reservoir_effect
suspected_reservoir_effect.description:
Specify whether there is a suspected carbon reservoir effect that
should be accounted for in analysis.
suspected_reservoir_effect.title: Suspected reservoir effect

carbon_nitro_ratio.name: carbon_nitro_ratio
carbon_nitro_ratio.description:
Atomic ratio of carbon to nitrogen. Used for quality control value in
proteinaceous samples for radiocarbon dating.
carbon_nitro_ratio.title: Carbon to nitrogen ratio

delta_15_n.name: delta_15_n
delta_15_n.description:
The delta nitrogen-15 value of the sample (δ15N), which is the ratio of the stable isotope
15N to 14N, expressed in per mil (‰) notation. Used as a quality control measurement.
delta_15_n.title: Delta 15N value

delta_15_n_error.name: delta_15_n_error
delta_15_n_error.description:
The error associated with the delta nitrogen-15 (δ15N) value expressed (‰) notation.
Used as a quality control measurement.
delta_15_n_error.title: Delta 15N error

delta_34_s.name: delta_34_s
delta_34_s.description:
The delta sulfur-34 value of the sample (δ34S), which is the ratio of the stable isotope
34S to 32S, expressed in per mil (‰) notation. Used as a quality control measurement.
delta_34_s.title: Delta 34S value

delta_34_s_error.name: delta_34_s_error
delta_34_s_error.description:
The error associated with the delta sulfur-34 (δ34S) value expressed (‰) notation.
Used as a quality control measurement.
delta_34_s_error.title: Delta 34S error

recrystalisation.name: recrystalisation
recrystalisation.description: Sample shows evidence of recrystalisation which should be accounted for during analysis.
recrystalisation.title: Evidence of recrystalisation

Specify whether there is a suspected carbon reservoir effect that
should be accounted for in analysis.
suspected_reservoir_effect.title: Suspected reservoir effect

recrystalisation.name: recrystalisation
recrystalisation.description: Sample shows evidence of recrystalisation which should be accounted for during analysis.
recrystalisation.title: Evidence of recrystalisation

F14CRadiocarbonDateProteinaceousSample.name: F14CRadiocarbonDateProteinaceousSample
F14CRadiocarbonDateProteinaceousSample.description: F14C value radiocarbon date of a proteinaceous sample
F14CRadiocarbonDateProteinaceousSample.title: F14C value radiocarbon date (proteinaceous)

lab_code.name: lab_code
lab_code.description:
Unique laboratory code designation of the institution that made the measurement.
This is the prefix used for each determination ID. The prefix should be
derived from: https://radiocarbon.webhost.uits.arizona.edu/laboratories.
lab_code.title: Laboratory code designation

lab_id.name: lab_id
lab_id.description:
The unique identifier associated with a specific radiocarbon determination,
without the radiocarbon laboratory identifier.
lab_id.title: Radiocarbon determination identifier

conventional_age.name: conventional_age
conventional_age.description:
The uncalibrated age from the laboratory measurement. Also known as the
conventional radiocarbon age (CRA). Should be a conventional 14C age (i.e., 14C year BP)
NOT in AD/BC format. This is typically the 'raw' age reported by the radiocarbon lab, in
Before Present (BP) notation.
conventional_age.title: Conventional radiocarbon age

conventional_age_error.name: conventional_age_error
conventional_age_error.description:
The 1-standard deviation around the conventional radiocarbon age (C14) measurement,
normally indicated as a ± after the main age. Must be in the same format (i.e. 14C yr BP).
Sometimes referred to as the "error" or "sigma" of the measurement.
conventional_age_error.title: Conventional radiocarbon age error

f14c.name: f14c
f14c.description:
The F14C value from the laboratory measurement, i.e. the fraction modern carbon.
For older determinations, generally equivalent to "percent modern" (pMC, or pM) divided by 100.
f14c.title: F14C radiocarbon value

f14c_error.name: f14c_error
f14c_error.description:
The 1-standard deviation uncertainty around the F14C (C14) measurement,
normally indicated as a ± after the main value. Must be in the same format.
Sometimes referred to as the "error" or "sigma" of the measurement.
f14c_error.title: F14C radiocarbon error

delta_13_c_calculation_method.name: delta_13_c_calculation_method
delta_13_c_calculation_method.description:
Whether the radiocarbon date was calculated with an AMS derived δ13C, an IRMS derived δ13C,
an alternative δ13C measurement method or an assumed δ13C.
delta_13_c_calculation_method.title: Delta 13C age calculation method

sample_ids.name: sample_ids
sample_ids.description:
Any identifier associated with the sample under measurement
(e.g. sample collection ID, archive object accession, ICOM/CIDOC Museum ID).
sample_ids.title: Sample identifiers

sample_material.name: sample_material
sample_material.description:
Material of the sample used to extract carbon used for radiocarbon dating measurements.
Use ontology terms where possible, e.g. from UBERON for anatomical parts, or ENVO for other
organic samples.
sample_material.title: Radiocarbon dating sample material

sample_taxon_id.name: sample_taxon_id
sample_taxon_id.description:
A taxonomic ID of the organism from which the sample used to extract carbon used for
radiocarbon measurement originated. The taxonomic ID should come from an established
ontology or database.
sample_taxon_id.title: Radiocarbon dating sample taxon

sample_taxon_id_confidence.name: sample_taxon_id_confidence
sample_taxon_id_confidence.description:
Specify the level of confidence of an exact taxon identification.
If secure identification, indicate 'true', if identification is unclear or
uncertain specify 'false'.
sample_taxon_id_confidence.title: Confident in taxon assignment

sample_taxon_scientific_name.name: sample_taxon_scientific_name
sample_taxon_scientific_name.description:
A scientific name of the taxon corresponding to the taxonomic ID, or when a
taxonomic ID does not currently exist for the specific taxon.
sample_taxon_scientific_name.title: Scientific name of the sample taxon

sample_anatomical_part.name: sample_anatomical_part
sample_anatomical_part.description: Anatomical part from which the sample is derived.
sample_anatomical_part.title: Anatomical part from which the sample is derived

suspected_sample_contamination.name: suspected_sample_contamination
suspected_sample_contamination.description:
Specify whether the sample has suspected contamination that may influence measurement
(organic glue, consolidant, rootlets, embalming solution, staining etc.).
suspected_sample_contamination.title: Suspected sample contamination

suspected_sample_contamination_descripti.name: suspected_sample_contamination_description
suspected_sample_contamination_descripti.description:
If a sample has a suspected contamination (suspected_sample_contamination), provide a short
description of the contamination.
suspected_sample_contamination_descripti.title: Suspected sample contamination description

examples.value: Consolidant was applied to the skull to stabilise the bone.
Sample was preserved in a embalming solution containing formaldehyde and alcohol.

sample_location.name: sample_location
sample_location.description: Name of the geographic location from which the sample originated.
sample_location.title: Sample location

decimal_latitude.name: decimal_latitude
decimal_latitude.description:
The geographic latitude (in decimal degrees, using the spatial reference system) of the geographic center of a dcterms:Location. Positive values are north
of the Equator, negative values are south of it. Legal values lie between -90 and 90, inclusive.
decimal_latitude.title: Decimal latitude

decimal_longitude.name: decimal_longitude
decimal_longitude.description:
The geographic longitude (in decimal degrees, using the spatial reference system) of the
geographic center of a dcterms:Location. Positive values are east of the Greenwich Meridian,
negative values are west of it. Legal values lie between -180 and 180, inclusive.
decimal_longitude.title: Decimal longitude

coordinate_precision.name: coordinate_precision
coordinate_precision.description:
A decimal representation of the precision of the coordinates given in the decimal_latitude
and decimal_longitude.
coordinate_precision.title: Coordinate precision

pretreatment_methods.name: pretreatment_methods
pretreatment_methods.description: Specify the types of general pretreatment methods applied for decontamination.
pretreatment_methods.title: Radiocarbon pretreatment methods

pretreatment_method_description.name: pretreatment_method_description
pretreatment_method_description.description: Description of specific pretreatment method used for decontamination of sample prior determination.
pretreatment_method_description.title: Radiocarbon pretreatment method description

examples.value: Samples were pretreated following Brock et al. (2010). Briefly, bone was demineralised (0.5M HCl, overnight), washed in base (0.1M NaOH, 30 min, RT) and acid (0.5M HCl, 1 hour, RT) before gelatinisation (0.001M HCl, 20 hours, 70oC), filtration (Ezee(TM)) and ultrafiltration (Vivaspin(TM) 30 kDa MWCO)
A dremel drill was used to remove visibly altered shell leaving dense translucent carbonate;  Charcoal was treated with HCl, NaOH and HCl.

pretreatment_method_protocol.name: pretreatment_method_protocol
pretreatment_method_protocol.description: A DOI, URL, or PMID to a publication describing the specific method of pretreatment applied.
pretreatment_method_protocol.title: Radiocarbon pretreatment method protocol

measurement_method.name: measurement_method
measurement_method.description: Type of measurement method the determination was made by.
measurement_method.title: Radiocarbon measurement method

sample_starting_weight.name: sample_starting_weight
sample_starting_weight.description: Amount of sample material used at beginning of measurement in miligrams (mg).
sample_starting_weight.title: Sample starting weight

pretreatment_yield.name: pretreatment_yield
pretreatment_yield.description: Amount of sample remaining after pretreatment in miligrams (mg).
pretreatment_yield.title: Weight after pretreatment

pretreatment_proportion_yield.name: pretreatment_proportion_yield
pretreatment_proportion_yield.description: Proportion of weight after pretreatment to sample starting weight represented as a value between 0 and 1.
pretreatment_proportion_yield.title: Proportion yield after pretreatment

carbon_proportion.name: carbon_proportion
carbon_proportion.description:
Proportion of carbon in a non-proteinaceous sample used for dating (such as charcoal),
expressed as a value between 0 and 1. Used as a quality control measurement.
carbon_proportion.title: Carbon proportion

delta_13_c.name: delta_13_c
delta_13_c.description:
The delta carbon-13 value of the sample (δ13C), which is the ratio of the stable isotope
13C to 12C, expressed in per mil (‰) notation. Used as a quality control measurement.
delta_13_c.title: Delta 13C value

delta_13_c_error.name: delta_13_c_error
delta_13_c_error.description:
The error associated with the delta carbon-13 (δ13C) value expressed (‰) notation.
Used as a quality control measurement.
delta_13_c_error.title: Delta 13C error

delta_13_c_method.name: delta_13_c_method
delta_13_c_method.description:
Which spectrophotometry method was used to measure the delta carbon-13 value,
either with Isotope Ratio Mass Spectrometer (IRMS) or Accelerated Mass Spectrometer (AMS).
delta_13_c_method.title: Delta 13C measurement method

suspected_reservoir_effect.name: suspected_reservoir_effect
suspected_reservoir_effect.description:
Specify whether there is a suspected carbon reservoir effect that
should be accounted for in analysis.
suspected_reservoir_effect.title: Suspected reservoir effect

carbon_nitro_ratio.name: carbon_nitro_ratio
carbon_nitro_ratio.description:
Atomic ratio of carbon to nitrogen. Used for quality control value in
proteinaceous samples for radiocarbon dating.
carbon_nitro_ratio.title: Carbon to nitrogen ratio

delta_15_n.name: delta_15_n
delta_15_n.description:
The delta nitrogen-15 value of the sample (δ15N), which is the ratio of the stable isotope
15N to 14N, expressed in per mil (‰) notation. Used as a quality control measurement.
delta_15_n.title: Delta 15N value

delta_15_n_error.name: delta_15_n_error
delta_15_n_error.description:
The error associated with the delta nitrogen-15 (δ15N) value expressed (‰) notation.
Used as a quality control measurement.
delta_15_n_error.title: Delta 15N error

delta_34_s.name: delta_34_s
delta_34_s.description:
The delta sulfur-34 value of the sample (δ34S), which is the ratio of the stable isotope
34S to 32S, expressed in per mil (‰) notation. Used as a quality control measurement.
delta_34_s.title: Delta 34S value

delta_34_s_error.name: delta_34_s_error
delta_34_s_error.description:
The error associated with the delta sulfur-34 (δ34S) value expressed (‰) notation.
Used as a quality control measurement.
delta_34_s_error.title: Delta 34S error

The delta carbon-13 value of the sample (δ13C), which is the ratio of the stable isotope
13C to 12C, expressed in per mil (‰) notation. Used as a quality control measurement.
delta_13_c.title: Delta 13C value

delta_13_c_error.name: delta_13_c_error
delta_13_c_error.description:
The error associated with the delta carbon-13 (δ13C) value expressed (‰) notation.
Used as a quality control measurement.
delta_13_c_error.title: Delta 13C error

delta_13_c_method.name: delta_13_c_method
delta_13_c_method.description:
Which spectrophotometry method was used to measure the delta carbon-13 value,
either with Isotope Ratio Mass Spectrometer (IRMS) or Accelerated Mass Spectrometer (AMS).
delta_13_c_method.title: Delta 13C measurement method

suspected_reservoir_effect.name: suspected_reservoir_effect
suspected_reservoir_effect.description:
Specify whether there is a suspected carbon reservoir effect that
should be accounted for in analysis.
suspected_reservoir_effect.title: Suspected reservoir effect

carbon_nitro_ratio.name: carbon_nitro_ratio
carbon_nitro_ratio.description:
Atomic ratio of carbon to nitrogen. Used for quality control value in
proteinaceous samples for radiocarbon dating.
carbon_nitro_ratio.title: Carbon to nitrogen ratio

delta_15_n.name: delta_15_n
delta_15_n.description:
The delta nitrogen-15 value of the sample (δ15N), which is the ratio of the stable isotope
15N to 14N, expressed in per mil (‰) notation. Used as a quality control measurement.
delta_15_n.title: Delta 15N value

delta_15_n_error.name: delta_15_n_error
delta_15_n_error.description:
The error associated with the delta nitrogen-15 (δ15N) value expressed (‰) notation.
Used as a quality control measurement.
delta_15_n_error.title: Delta 15N error

delta_34_s.name: delta_34_s
delta_34_s.description:
The delta sulfur-34 value of the sample (δ34S), which is the ratio of the stable isotope
34S to 32S, expressed in per mil (‰) notation. Used as a quality control measurement.
delta_34_s.title: Delta 34S value

delta_34_s_error.name: delta_34_s_error
delta_34_s_error.description:
The error associated with the delta sulfur-34 (δ34S) value expressed (‰) notation.
Used as a quality control measurement.
delta_34_s_error.title: Delta 34S error

ConventionalAgeRadiocarbonDateCarbonateS.name: ConventionalAgeRadiocarbonDateCarbonateSample
ConventionalAgeRadiocarbonDateCarbonateS.description: Conventional age radiocarbon date of a carbonate sample
ConventionalAgeRadiocarbonDateCarbonateS.title: Conventional age radiocarbon date (carbonate)

lab_code.name: lab_code
lab_code.description:
Unique laboratory code designation of the institution that made the measurement.
This is the prefix used for each determination ID. The prefix should be
derived from: https://radiocarbon.webhost.uits.arizona.edu/laboratories.
lab_code.title: Laboratory code designation

lab_id.name: lab_id
lab_id.description:
The unique identifier associated with a specific radiocarbon determination,
without the radiocarbon laboratory identifier.
lab_id.title: Radiocarbon determination identifier

conventional_age.name: conventional_age
conventional_age.description:
The uncalibrated age from the laboratory measurement. Also known as the
conventional radiocarbon age (CRA). Should be a conventional 14C age (i.e., 14C year BP)
NOT in AD/BC format. This is typically the 'raw' age reported by the radiocarbon lab, in
Before Present (BP) notation.
conventional_age.title: Conventional radiocarbon age

conventional_age_error.name: conventional_age_error
conventional_age_error.description:
The 1-standard deviation around the conventional radiocarbon age (C14) measurement,
normally indicated as a ± after the main age. Must be in the same format (i.e. 14C yr BP).
Sometimes referred to as the "error" or "sigma" of the measurement.
conventional_age_error.title: Conventional radiocarbon age error

f14c.name: f14c
f14c.description:
The F14C value from the laboratory measurement, i.e. the fraction modern carbon.
For older determinations, generally equivalent to "percent modern" (pMC, or pM) divided by 100.
f14c.title: F14C radiocarbon value

f14c_error.name: f14c_error
f14c_error.description:
The 1-standard deviation uncertainty around the F14C (C14) measurement,
normally indicated as a ± after the main value. Must be in the same format.
Sometimes referred to as the "error" or "sigma" of the measurement.
f14c_error.title: F14C radiocarbon error

delta_13_c_calculation_method.name: delta_13_c_calculation_method
delta_13_c_calculation_method.description:
Whether the radiocarbon date was calculated with an AMS derived δ13C, an IRMS derived δ13C,
an alternative δ13C measurement method or an assumed δ13C.
delta_13_c_calculation_method.title: Delta 13C age calculation method

sample_ids.name: sample_ids
sample_ids.description:
Any identifier associated with the sample under measurement
(e.g. sample collection ID, archive object accession, ICOM/CIDOC Museum ID).
sample_ids.title: Sample identifiers

sample_material.name: sample_material
sample_material.description:
Material of the sample used to extract carbon used for radiocarbon dating measurements.
Use ontology terms where possible, e.g. from UBERON for anatomical parts, or ENVO for other
organic samples.
sample_material.title: Radiocarbon dating sample material

sample_taxon_id.name: sample_taxon_id
sample_taxon_id.description:
A taxonomic ID of the organism from which the sample used to extract carbon used for
radiocarbon measurement originated. The taxonomic ID should come from an established
ontology or database.
sample_taxon_id.title: Radiocarbon dating sample taxon

sample_taxon_id_confidence.name: sample_taxon_id_confidence
sample_taxon_id_confidence.description:
Specify the level of confidence of an exact taxon identification.
If secure identification, indicate 'true', if identification is unclear or
uncertain specify 'false'.
sample_taxon_id_confidence.title: Confident in taxon assignment

sample_taxon_scientific_name.name: sample_taxon_scientific_name
sample_taxon_scientific_name.description:
A scientific name of the taxon corresponding to the taxonomic ID, or when a
taxonomic ID does not currently exist for the specific taxon.
sample_taxon_scientific_name.title: Scientific name of the sample taxon

sample_anatomical_part.name: sample_anatomical_part
sample_anatomical_part.description: Anatomical part from which the sample is derived.
sample_anatomical_part.title: Anatomical part from which the sample is derived

suspected_sample_contamination.name: suspected_sample_contamination
suspected_sample_contamination.description:
Specify whether the sample has suspected contamination that may influence measurement
(organic glue, consolidant, rootlets, embalming solution, staining etc.).
suspected_sample_contamination.title: Suspected sample contamination

suspected_sample_contamination_descripti.name: suspected_sample_contamination_description
suspected_sample_contamination_descripti.description:
If a sample has a suspected contamination (suspected_sample_contamination), provide a short
description of the contamination.
suspected_sample_contamination_descripti.title: Suspected sample contamination description

examples.value: Consolidant was applied to the skull to stabilise the bone.
Sample was preserved in a embalming solution containing formaldehyde and alcohol.

sample_location.name: sample_location
sample_location.description: Name of the geographic location from which the sample originated.
sample_location.title: Sample location

decimal_latitude.name: decimal_latitude
decimal_latitude.description:
The geographic latitude (in decimal degrees, using the spatial reference system) of the geographic center of a dcterms:Location. Positive values are north
of the Equator, negative values are south of it. Legal values lie between -90 and 90, inclusive.
decimal_latitude.title: Decimal latitude

decimal_longitude.name: decimal_longitude
decimal_longitude.description:
The geographic longitude (in decimal degrees, using the spatial reference system) of the
geographic center of a dcterms:Location. Positive values are east of the Greenwich Meridian,
negative values are west of it. Legal values lie between -180 and 180, inclusive.
decimal_longitude.title: Decimal longitude

coordinate_precision.name: coordinate_precision
coordinate_precision.description:
A decimal representation of the precision of the coordinates given in the decimal_latitude
and decimal_longitude.
coordinate_precision.title: Coordinate precision

pretreatment_methods.name: pretreatment_methods
pretreatment_methods.description: Specify the types of general pretreatment methods applied for decontamination.
pretreatment_methods.title: Radiocarbon pretreatment methods

pretreatment_method_description.name: pretreatment_method_description
pretreatment_method_description.description: Description of specific pretreatment method used for decontamination of sample prior determination.
pretreatment_method_description.title: Radiocarbon pretreatment method description

examples.value: Samples were pretreated following Brock et al. (2010). Briefly, bone was demineralised (0.5M HCl, overnight), washed in base (0.1M NaOH, 30 min, RT) and acid (0.5M HCl, 1 hour, RT) before gelatinisation (0.001M HCl, 20 hours, 70oC), filtration (Ezee(TM)) and ultrafiltration (Vivaspin(TM) 30 kDa MWCO)
A dremel drill was used to remove visibly altered shell leaving dense translucent carbonate;  Charcoal was treated with HCl, NaOH and HCl.

pretreatment_method_protocol.name: pretreatment_method_protocol
pretreatment_method_protocol.description: A DOI, URL, or PMID to a publication describing the specific method of pretreatment applied.
pretreatment_method_protocol.title: Radiocarbon pretreatment method protocol

measurement_method.name: measurement_method
measurement_method.description: Type of measurement method the determination was made by.
measurement_method.title: Radiocarbon measurement method

sample_starting_weight.name: sample_starting_weight
sample_starting_weight.description: Amount of sample material used at beginning of measurement in miligrams (mg).
sample_starting_weight.title: Sample starting weight

pretreatment_yield.name: pretreatment_yield
pretreatment_yield.description: Amount of sample remaining after pretreatment in miligrams (mg).
pretreatment_yield.title: Weight after pretreatment

pretreatment_proportion_yield.name: pretreatment_proportion_yield
pretreatment_proportion_yield.description: Proportion of weight after pretreatment to sample starting weight represented as a value between 0 and 1.
pretreatment_proportion_yield.title: Proportion yield after pretreatment

carbon_proportion.name: carbon_proportion
carbon_proportion.description:
Proportion of carbon in a non-proteinaceous sample used for dating (such as charcoal),
expressed as a value between 0 and 1. Used as a quality control measurement.
carbon_proportion.title: Carbon proportion

delta_13_c.name: delta_13_c
delta_13_c.description:
The delta carbon-13 value of the sample (δ13C), which is the ratio of the stable isotope
13C to 12C, expressed in per mil (‰) notation. Used as a quality control measurement.
delta_13_c.title: Delta 13C value

delta_13_c_error.name: delta_13_c_error
delta_13_c_error.description:
The error associated with the delta carbon-13 (δ13C) value expressed (‰) notation.
Used as a quality control measurement.
delta_13_c_error.title: Delta 13C error

delta_13_c_method.name: delta_13_c_method
delta_13_c_method.description:
Which spectrophotometry method was used to measure the delta carbon-13 value,
either with Isotope Ratio Mass Spectrometer (IRMS) or Accelerated Mass Spectrometer (AMS).
delta_13_c_method.title: Delta 13C measurement method

suspected_reservoir_effect.name: suspected_reservoir_effect
suspected_reservoir_effect.description:
Specify whether there is a suspected carbon reservoir effect that
should be accounted for in analysis.
suspected_reservoir_effect.title: Suspected reservoir effect

recrystalisation.name: recrystalisation
recrystalisation.description: Sample shows evidence of recrystalisation which should be accounted for during analysis.
recrystalisation.title: Evidence of recrystalisation
